title: Inauguration of "Vinod Dham Centre of Excellence for Semiconductors and Microelectronics
info: Inauguration of "Vinod Dham Centre of Excellence for Semiconductors and Microelectronics" on 7th April, 2025, Chief Guest is Shri. Ashwini Vaishnaw, Hon'ble Minister for Railways, Information & Broadcasting, and Electronics & IT, Government of India. Guest of Honour is Shri. Vinod Dham, Padma Bhushan 2025, Distinguished Alumnus and Father of the Pentium Processor.   Better known as “Father of the Pentium Chip’, Sh. Vinod Dham has over 40+ years of experience in developing semiconductor products, technologies and Venture Capital. He has been named as one of the top 25 executives in the computer industry and one of the top 100 most influential Asian Americans. Recently, he has been involved in mentoring start-up entrepreneurs, as an Angel Investor. He is a founder of IndoUS Venture Partners (IUVP), an India focused early stage venture capital fund. He has pledges to contribute Rs. 1 Crore to DTU towards Vinod Dham Centre of Excellence for Semiconductors and Microelectronics (VDCoE4SM).

title: DTU has initiated a series of talks by distinguished speakers in India, the speaker of the first talk of the series is Padma Shri awardee Dr Ravi Grover, the Indian Nuclear Scientist, and our own Alumnus of 1970 batch, Mechanical Engineering.
info: Dr Ravi Grover is well known in India as a proponent of nuclear Energy who played a key role in India’s nuclear program. Ravi B. Grover completed his bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from the prestigious Delhi College of Engineering in 1970 and joined the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre. He completed a PhD in mechanical engineering from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, in 1982.  He is the founding Director and later on Vice-Chancellor of Homi Bhabha National Institute (HBNI). He played a key role as negotiator in Indo-US nuclear deal in 2007. He received Padma Shri in 2014 in view of his contribution to India’s nuclear program. During a career spanning four decades, Dr. Grover has distinguished himself as an academic, research and development engineer and a science administrator. His knowledge of nuclear engineering and nuclear law has earned him the title 'nuclear diplomat'.

title: The Scholarship of Rs. 10 Lacs instituted by our distinguished alumnus Shri. Naveen Kukreja, Alumnus of 1999 batch, Electrical Engineering Department.
info: Two scholarships namely, “(i) N.C Kukreja and Santosh Kukreja Scholarship, and (ii) Nand Lal Kukreja Scholarship” each with an amount of Rs. 1,00,000/- per annum shall be awarded each year to two students of 1st year (one scholarship for general category student and another scholarship for backward class student), on Means basis, of any discipline for a period of five years. The students with low family income may be considered, and if there is a tie in the income criteria, then the student with high JEE rank may be considered for award the scholarship

info: Distinguished alumna/alumnus Professor Prateek Sharma (Class of 1989, Civil Engineering) assumes the esteemed position of Vice Chancellor at Delhi Technological University (DTU).
